alert.note: Alert for Lake (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Indiana, including the following area, central Lake County, Indiana. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 425 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall due to a nearly stationary thunderstorm located from Schererville to Crown Point. Rain rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are likely with this storm. - Some locations that may experience minor street flooding include... Merrillville, Schererville, Hobart, Crown Point. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
